nextjs-tailwind-starter.name: nextjs-tailwind-starter
nextjs-tailwind-starter.description: Full-stack Next.js starter with Tailwind, Prisma, and auth
nextjs-tailwind-starter.author: planmode
nextjs-tailwind-starter.content:
# Next.js + Tailwind Starter

1. Create a new Next.js project: `npx create-next-app@latest {{project_name}}`
2. Install Tailwind CSS and configure
3. Set up Prisma with PostgreSQL
4. Add authentication with {{auth_provider}}
5. Configure environment variables
6. Set up deployment pipeline

typescript-strict.name: typescript-strict
typescript-strict.description: Strict TypeScript configuration rules for safer, more maintainable code
typescript-strict.author: planmode
typescript-strict.content:
- Always enable strict mode in tsconfig.json
- Use explicit return types on exported functions
- Prefer `unknown` over `any`
- Use discriminated unions over optional properties
- Enable noUncheckedIndexedAccess

tailwind-best-practices.name: tailwind-best-practices
tailwind-best-practices.description: Tailwind CSS coding standards: utility-first patterns, component extraction, responsive design
tailwind-best-practices.author: planmode
tailwind-best-practices.content:
- Use utility classes directly, avoid @apply in most cases
- Extract components when a pattern repeats 3+ times
- Mobile-first responsive design (sm:, md:, lg:)
- Use design tokens via theme() for consistency
- Keep class lists readable with logical grouping

prisma-setup.name: prisma-setup
prisma-setup.description: Set up Prisma ORM with PostgreSQL, migrations, and seed data
prisma-setup.author: dbtools
prisma-setup.content:
# Prisma Setup

1. Install Prisma: `npm install prisma @prisma/client`
2. Initialize: `npx prisma init`
3. Configure schema.prisma with PostgreSQL provider
4. Define your data model
5. Run initial migration: `npx prisma migrate dev`
6. Set up seed script in package.json

docker-compose-stack.name: docker-compose-stack
docker-compose-stack.description: Production-ready Docker Compose setup with Nginx, app server, and database
docker-compose-stack.author: devopskit
docker-compose-stack.content:
# Docker Compose Stack

1. Create Dockerfile for the application
2. Create docker-compose.yml with services
3. Configure Nginx reverse proxy
4. Set up {{db_type}} database container
5. Add health checks and restart policies
6. Configure volumes for data persistence

rest-api-generator.name: rest-api-generator
rest-api-generator.description: Generate a complete REST API with CRUD endpoints, validation, and error handling
rest-api-generator.author: apigen
rest-api-generator.content:
Generate a complete REST API for the {{resource}} resource using {{framework}}. Include:
- GET /{{resource}} — list all
- GET /{{resource}}/:id — get one
- POST /{{resource}} — create
- PUT /{{resource}}/:id — update
- DELETE /{{resource}}/:id — delete

Include input validation, error handling, and TypeScript types.

vitest-setup.name: vitest-setup
vitest-setup.description: Configure Vitest with TypeScript, coverage, and sensible defaults
vitest-setup.author: testkit
vitest-setup.content:
# Vitest Setup

1. Install vitest and dependencies
2. Create vitest.config.ts
3. Configure TypeScript paths
4. Set up coverage with @vitest/coverage-v8
5. Add test scripts to package.json
6. Create example test file

add-authentication.name: add-authentication
add-authentication.description: Add authentication to any web framework with NextAuth, Clerk, or Lucia
add-authentication.author: authkit
add-authentication.content:
# Add Authentication

1. Install {{auth_provider}} for {{framework}}
2. Configure session management
3. Add auth middleware to routes
4. Create login/signup pages
5. Add protected route examples
6. Set up OAuth providers (Google, GitHub)

github-actions-ci.name: github-actions-ci
github-actions-ci.description: Set up GitHub Actions CI/CD pipeline with testing, linting, and deployment
github-actions-ci.author: devopskit
github-actions-ci.content:
# GitHub Actions CI/CD

1. Create .github/workflows/ci.yml
2. Configure Node.js matrix (18, 20, 22)
3. Add lint, typecheck, and test steps
4. Set up caching for node_modules
5. Add deployment step for main branch
6. Configure branch protection rules

weather-image.name: weather-image
weather-image.description: Generate weather-themed images for any city with dynamic data injection
weather-image.author: creative
weather-image.content: Create a {{style}} image that shows the weather in {{location}} today. Make it atmospheric and detailed.

python-fastapi.name: python-fastapi
python-fastapi.description: Scaffold a FastAPI project with SQLAlchemy, Alembic, and Docker
python-fastapi.author: pydev
python-fastapi.content:
# FastAPI Project Setup

1. Create project structure with src layout
2. Set up FastAPI with uvicorn
3. Configure SQLAlchemy with async support
4. Set up Alembic for migrations
5. Create Dockerfile and docker-compose.yml
6. Add health check and API docs endpoints

security-headers.name: security-headers
security-headers.description: Enforce security headers, CSP, and HTTPS best practices in web applications
security-headers.author: secteam
security-headers.content:
- Always set Content-Security-Policy headers
- Enable Strict-Transport-Security (HSTS)
- Set X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff
- Set X-Frame-Options: DENY
- Configure referrer-policy: strict-origin-when-cross-origin
- Never expose server version headers
